title: Brookfield Weighs Spinning Out Asset-Management Business
sub_head: The Toronto firm pegs the stand-alone value of its asset-management business at as much as $100 billion
body:
Brookfield Asset Management Inc. is weighing a plan to spin out its asset-management business, with Chief Executive Bruce Flatt saying the operation could be worth as much as $100 billion.
Many investors prefer fund managers to be “asset light,” Mr. Flatt said in a letter to shareholders Thursday, while Brookfield is seen as “asset heavy,” partly because it has $50 billion of its own investment capital.
